Package org.opensextant.giscore.output

Class XmlOutputStreamBase

java.lang.Object
org.opensextant.giscore.output.StreamVisitorBase
org.opensextant.giscore.output.XmlOutputStreamBase
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, AutoCloseable, IStreamVisitor, IGISOutputStream
Direct Known Subclasses:
GeoRSSOutputStream, KmlOutputStream, XmlGdbOutputStream
public class XmlOutputStreamBase extends StreamVisitorBase implements IGISOutputStream
A base class for those gis output stream implementations that output to XML files.
Author:
DRAND

  • Constructor Details

    • XmlOutputStreamBase

      protected XmlOutputStreamBase()
      Ctor

    • XmlOutputStreamBase

      public XmlOutputStreamBase(OutputStream stream, String encoding) throws XMLStreamException
      Creates a new XML output stream to write data to the specified underlying output stream with specified encoding. The encoding on writeStartDocument() call to the writer must match encoding of the XmlOutputStreamBase.
      Parameters:
      stream - the underlying input stream
      encoding - the encoding to use
      Throws:
      XMLStreamException - if there is an error with the underlying XML

    • XmlOutputStreamBase

      public XmlOutputStreamBase(OutputStream stream) throws XMLStreamException
      Creates a new XML output stream to write data to the specified underlying output stream with default encoding 'Cp1252'.
      Parameters:
      stream - the underlying input stream.
      Throws:
      XMLStreamException - if there is an error with the underlying XML

    • visit

      public void visit(Comment comment)
      Writes XML comment to the output stream if text comment value is not null or empty. The comment can contain any unescaped character (e.g. "declarations for head & body") and any occurrences of "--" (double-hyphen) will be hex-escaped to --
      Specified by:
      visit in interface IStreamVisitor
      Overrides:
      visit in class StreamVisitorBase
      Parameters:
      comment - Comment, never null
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if there is an error with the underlying XML

    • visit

      public void visit(Row row)
      Visit a row. Output as an XML Comment.
      Specified by:
      visit in interface IStreamVisitor
      Overrides:
      visit in class StreamVisitorBase
      Parameters:
      row -
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if there is an error with the underlying XML

    • handleCharacters

      protected void handleCharacters(String outputString) throws XMLStreamException
      See if the characters include special characters, and if it does use a CDATA. Special characters here means anything that isn't alphanumeric or writespace - CDATA is always valid, so this keeps it simple.
      Parameters:
      outputString -
      Throws:
      XMLStreamException - if there is an error with the underlying XML

    • handleNonNullSimpleElement

      protected void handleNonNullSimpleElement(String tag, Object content) throws XMLStreamException
      Handle a simple element with non-null text, a common case for KML
      Parameters:
      tag - local name of the tag, may not be null
      content - Content to write as parsed character data, if null then an empty XML element is written
      Throws:
      XMLStreamException - if there is an error with the underlying XML

    • handleSimpleElement

      protected void handleSimpleElement(String tag, Object content) throws XMLStreamException
      Handle a simple element with text, a common case for KML
      Parameters:
      tag - local name of the tag, may not be null
      content - Content to write as parsed character data, if null then an empty XML element is written
      Throws:
      XMLStreamException - if there is an error with the underlying XML

    • handleXmlElement

      protected void handleXmlElement(Element el, Namespace parentNamespace) throws XMLStreamException
      Write an element
      Parameters:
      el - the element, never null
      parentNamespace - namespace of parent element, null if root element or unknown
      Throws:
      XMLStreamException - if there is an error with the underlying XML

    • writeAsComment

      Write formatted element inline within XML comment
      Parameters:

    • escapeAttribute

      protected static void escapeAttribute(StringBuilder sb, String key, String val)

    • handleSimpleElement

      protected void handleSimpleElement(Namespace ns, String tag, String content) throws XMLStreamException
      Handles simple element with a namespace.
      Parameters:
      ns - Namespace. If null then delagates to handleSimpleElement with name and value.
      tag - local name of the element, may not be null
      content - Content to write as parsed character data, if null then an empty XML element is written
      Throws:
      XMLStreamException - if there is an error with the underlying XML

    • writeNamespace

      protected void writeNamespace(Namespace ns) throws XMLStreamException
      Writes a namespace to the output stream. If the prefix argument to this method is the empty string, "xmlns", or null this method will delegate to writeDefaultNamespace
      Parameters:
      ns - Namespace
      Throws:
      XMLStreamException - if there is an error with the underlying XML
      IllegalStateException - if the current state does not allow Namespace writing

    • formatDouble

      protected String formatDouble(double d)
      Formats double values suitable for XML output using DecimalFormater. Rounds off decimal value at 10-decimal places eliminating most common round-off errors which are typically at 14 decimal places or beyond (e.g. -34.93 may get converted to -34.93000000000001 with conversion from decimal degrees to radians and back to degrees.
      Parameters:
      d - double value
      Returns:
      formatted decimal value
